textRuns.value: What's New! April 21, 2025
NEW YOY by Customer & Intercompany Dashboard:

We have created a new dashboard that is designed to give you a similar view as the YOY by BU & Customer dashboard, but it includes Intercompany revenue and it focuses on the customer rather than the BU.
Many aspects of this new dashboard are the same as the
YOY by BU & Customer dashboard such as matching KPIs, Slicers, and the Current Period Revenue by Reporting Channel visual. However, the other visuals do have some differences as outlined below.
Current vs Prior Revenue by Customer Clustered Bar Chart:

This visual is in the same location and functions the same as the Current vs Prior Period Revenue by BU visual in the YOY by BU & Customer dashboard, with the difference being that the Y axis is Customer Name on this new visual rather than Business Unit.
Revenue by Month Clustered Bar Chart:

This visual is new to this dashboard, and replaces the Current vs Prior Period Revenue by Division visual that's found in the YOY by BU & Customer dashboard. This new visual compares current and prior period revenues by month of the year.
Detail Table:

This table functions the same as the detail table in YOY by BU & Customer in that it drills down from Customer to Channel to Product Type to Item. It also includes the values found in the other dashboard which are Current Period Revenue, Prior Period Revenue, and CY-PY Difference. The difference between these tables is that YOY by Customer & Intercompany also includes a CY - PY % Difference column, which details the % difference between Current Period and Prior Period Revenue.
What's New! December 12, 2024
Mobile Report Views:

We have created a mobile version of most dashboards for use with the Power BI mobile app, except for YOY Detail and Revenue Detail Reporting. The vertical mobile view contains all KPIs, slicers, and visualizations except for matrix or table visuals. All visuals and dashboards will show on mobile when viewed horizontally.
What's New! November 21, 2024
Owner Slicer Updates:
We have

updated the Owner mapping to align with the TPVI restructuring.  One note, the revenue for the Fridley/Monarch accounts will show as John Tenwinkel, until the migrations occur to Travel Tags/Monarch, while will allow the data to align to Mike Robinson.  Historical revenue will continue to show as John Tenwinkel.
What's New! November 15, 2024
Slicer Updates:
We have updated the reporting channel slicers to include product type descriptions as a hierarchical filter across all pages.
What's New! October 23, 2024
Customer Sales Org Report Removed:
Due to low usage and potential data quality issues, we've removed the Customer Sales org report from the Taylor Revenue app.
What's New! September 19, 2024
Account Manager Security:

We've implemented row level security for account manager users and also updated the data model in the report so that the mapping for customer accounts incorporates the source system as well. This is important when two different source systems use the same customer ID for different accounts.
What's New! September 5, 2024
Security Issue Fixed:

When we fixed the last security issue, we caused a new one. There was an issue with our row level security where some sales reps were unable to see their accounts. This issue has been resolved AND reps who have split accounts can see all of the account's revenue.
What's New! August 22, 2024
Security Issue Fixed:
There was an issue with our row level security where sales reps who were splitting an account could only see a percentage of the account's revenue. This issue has been resolved.
What's New! July 11, 2024
Revenue by Product Type Issue Fixed:

There was an issue where the Prior Period Revenue was not matching between the Channel Revenue Dashboard and the Revenue by Product Type Dashboard when filtered to a single Reporting Channel. The issue has been corrected.
What's New! April 19, 2024
Business Owner Filtering Fixed:

There was an issue where the value showing the wrong values for a few solutions. It turned out to be an issue with the data model where the business owner slicer was not filtering properly. This issue has been corrected.
What's New! April 17, 2024
$0 Revenue now Included on Revenue by Plant:
Previously, we were not listing accounts or plants on the detail page if the customer or plant did not have revenue in the current period.
This resulted in a misleading total revenue for the previous period
. This issue has been corrected.
What's New! April 3, 2024
NEW Intercompany Revenue Dashboard:

We've added a new dashboard to the Taylor Revenue collection to focus in on intercompany revenue, which is intentionally excluded from most of the other revenue dashboards. This new dashboard includes the standard set of slicers across the top, with the following added features:
KPIs included are Current Period Revenue, Current Period GM% (gross margin percent), Prior Period Revenue and Prior Period GM5.
Intercompany Revenue by Source bar chart shows current and prior period revenue broken out by the source of the data
Intercompany Revenue by Customer bar chart shows current and prior period revenue broken out by customer
Matrix of Intercompany Revenue across the bottom, showing revenue, cost, gross margin and gross margin % for the current period and the prior period.
What's New! March 7, 2024
Slicer Revamps:
We have made changes to slicers that effect all dashboards in the report.
A new slicer for BICP Customer Channel has been added.
The Division Sales Leader and Region Sales Leader slicers have been combined into one slicer called Division, Region Sales Leader.
The Buying Group, Customer slicer has been renamed to Buying Group/Customer Grouping, Customer.
Slicer order has changed to more accurately group related slicers together.
New Dashboards!:
We have added two new dashboards, Revenue by Plant and Revenue by Product Type. Below are the unique features for these two new dashboards.
Revenue by Plant:
A new dashboard that allows you to compare previous and current period revenue by plant, region, sales rep, and customer.
Revenue by Plant bar Chart:

This bar chart is found in the middle left side of the dashboard. It displays Current Period and Prior Period Revenue represented by different colored bars for each plant. Hover over a bar to see details into that period's revenue for the corresponding plant. Click on a plant to filter the rest of the dashboard.
Detail Table:

This table is found along the bottom of the dashboard. It breaks down Current Period Revenue, Prior Period Revenue, and the difference between those two periods by Region, Sales Rep, Plant, and Customer.
Revenue by Product Type:
A new dashboard that allows you to compare previous and current period revenue by product type, region, sales rep, and customer.
Revenue by Product Type bar Chart:

This bar chart is found in the middle left side of the dashboard. It displays Current Period and Prior Period Revenue which are represented by different colored bars for each product type. Hover over a bar to see details into that period's revenue for the corresponding product type. Click on a product type to filter the rest of the dashboard.
Detail Table:

This table is found along the bottom of the dashboard. It breaks down Current Period and Prior Period Revenue as well as the difference between the two periods by Region, Sales Rep, Product Type, and Customer.
Visuals found in both new dashboards
There are two visuals which are found on both of the new dashboards.
Revenue by Sales Rep Bar Chart:

This bar chart is found in the middle right side of each dashboard. Similarly to the other bar charts on the new dashboards, it shows Current and Prior period Revenue which are represented by different colored bars for each sales rep. Hover over a bar to see details into that period's revenue for the corresponding sales rep. Click on a sales rep to filter the rest of the dashboard.
Revenue by Region Donut Chart:

This donut chart is found in the middle of each dashboard. The slices represent Current Period Revenue for each region. Hovering over a slice will show you details into Current Period Revenue, as well as Prior Period Revenue. Click on a slice to filter the dashboard by the corresponding region.
What's New! January 30, 2024
Updated Terminology:
Throughout the report, we've updated the terms used to be more correct and consistent. Changes include:
"Current Year" is now referred to as "Current Period". Similarly, "Prior Year" or "Last Year" is now referred to as "Prior Period"
"Plant Name" is now simply "Plant"
Date Table Updates:

This report was previously using a date table from a different database, which affected performance and made the report more difficult to maintain. We've changed it to use the date table on the same database as the rest of the tables.
Alignment Changes:
We've also changed the slicer alignment so that they align with each other both vertically and horizontally.
What's New! January 11, 2024
2021 Data Temporarily Reinstated:

Our normal date range for this report is two years plus current, so when 2024 began, 2021 data disappeared. We've had a request to pull 2021 data back in for a period of time; however, it will be removed again in the near future.
Default Year:
To avoid having to update the default year selection each year, we've defaulted the year selection to Current Year (rather than a numeric value).
Back End Updates:
We've revamped the back end of this report to adhere to our development standards. This change will allow easier maintenance in the future.
What's New! November 7, 2023
Year and Month Slicers Separated:
based on feedback after our latest update, we've separated the year and month slicers, as they used to be before our October 5 update.
What's New! October 19, 2023
Cover Page Updated:
We've added a list of the source systems included in this report, along with a short description of each.
What's New! October 5, 2023
Report Look & Feel:

We've updated the look and feel of this report to match the standard style guidelines for our dashboards, which means not only will you see changes to how the dashboards look, the slicers all allow for searching and select all and when you click on something in one the visuals, it will filter the rest of the dashboard rather than highlighting.
Release Notes and Quick Tips:

We also added this release notes page and a new Quick Tips page to provide helpful information about how to use the dashboards, including features that might not be immediately apparent on first glance.
Cover Page Updated:
We've also updated the information on the cover page to provide important information about the data sources used in this report.
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

On the YOY Detail and Channel Revenue pages, we have added some KPIs on the left hand side of the dashboard. These KPIs help point out key data indicators to provide helpful insights when using your dashboards.
Anomalies Added:

On the Anomaly Detail page, you might find some pink bubbles on the chart. These bubbles point out anomalies in the data that might merit further investigation. Hover over any of the anomaly bubbles to see more information about that anomaly.
